reviews.sentence: Quick in and out this is the place to be. Location staff room.

The fact that they had a shuttle service to help me get aroundThe f t on desk staff was not as informative as they could have been. They left out key details when you ask them questions. This hotel was okay I wish it had been renovated and the staff was a little bit kinder. Overall the room was decent I enjoyed my stay. I will come back again but it would not be my first choice.

Quick stay but very nice. I was in town to visit another Crowne Plaza downtown for my family reunion and this hotel was very comfortable and the king rooms were very spacious. Spacious rooms Close to the but airport a plus but there were no other amenities close by that was in walking distance other than a gas station store next door.

Clean quiet and comfortable just a little old. location is excellent just off the interstate. the room was quiet and comfortable. Old pull up bars out back but hey at least they have some. The beds were fairly new and quite comfortable and it was clean. If this were a friends house who was letting me crash for the weekend it was great just a little old and used for a modern hotel room. Common spaces are fine. Everything worked in the room no maintenance issues inside the romif you need a brand new hotel room this is not the place for you. It is one of the most dated rooms I have stayed in and somewhat shabbier than most but just due to age of the room in general. Other minor tweak is that the corridors on the 9th floor smelled bad could not figure it out but not pleasant the room had no discernible odor. Internet access was fine during off hours but quite slow during peak times.

Clean Rooms and Great staff but not deserving of the Crown Plaza flag. I have stayed in many hotels in this star rating and flagged with this hotels name. Although the experience was positive overall I was disappointed with the age and condition of the building itself. There was a definite older feel and hallways had a slight musty smell. The room was very clean but the toilet did not stop making noise the duration of my stay. If you are able to get the room at the Hotwire rate then it is a good value for a safe and clean hotel. The sheets on one bed were the rubbery type you are supposed to put over the mattress for bed wetting. Pillows were not lumpy but a bit over inflated for my tastes. The breakfast buffet looked appetizing but was an additional xx every day. If you are able to get the room at the Hotwire rate then it is a good value for a safe and clean hotel. If you have to pay retail you are probably better of going down the street a bitProsNo Fee to ParkNo mandatory valetCleanExceptional stafGod bar restaurantRom service was very quickConsVisibly older buildingMusty Smell in upper halwaysMaintenance isuesPaid breakfast. No Shuttle from DFW.

Stranded in Dallas due to a flight cancellation. Located right off the highway room relatively quiet for overlooking 35E Hotel room was clean. did not visit the restaurant bartender was accommodating.

Concert hotel stay. Room was very nice and spacious. Check in and out was a breeze. Bar drink prices a little high price. And the breakfast was not worth the price. Thank goodness it was included with my room rate. Will stay again if in town.

Some good services but let down in a few areas. Good breakfast. Friendly waiting staff at both breakfast and evening meal in the bar. Room was good overall with good view. Comfortable bed. Shuttle service was very useful and the drivers very friendly and helpful. Location not ideal being a few miles out of the city but I wanted the cheaper rate. Some staff on reception looked demoralised but they were helpful when I needed information. I noticed this more as I had been staying in the Wichita Mariot for the week before. Air con faulty. I reported it and the heating mode was fixed but then I could not get it it to supply cool air when I needed it. Water in the bathroom was cold on the first night. Reported and fixed.
The view and it was easy to access. The beds were horrible.

Terrible experience. I booked and paid to stay in the hotel. After I arrived to the hotel around midnight the room they provided was terrible. The smell of the room was unbearable. I asked the front desk to change the room but they were not willing by saying they are overboked. And told me to cancel my reservation if I do not like the room. Because of this I spent my night looking for room in another hotels. I will never recommend this hotel to others.

Good price Warm room. Pets cost extra. Staff was extremely helpful A. Had booked a room w King size bed. Had 2 beds non king when I arrived. Asked staff if we could switch. They accommodated. Still do not know if I made an error in booking or they made and error. That was corrected regardless. The staff asked If we had pets. We had our small dog they told me it was 40 fee. I see pet friendly but did not see anything on booking that said additional fees were required. Maybe I missed it Maybe bokingcom missed it. This should definitely be something that is addressed. The Room was nice as expected. The AC unit was sub par. The we turned down the unit to upper 60s. It ran all night and the room was only comfortable on one side. The AC never seemed to cool the entire room. Not a good thing. I would expect this in a lesser chain. Price was great until the 40 upcharge for the pet. This would not have been an issue again if it was known from the get go. I would stay here again I would complain if the AC was an issue to try to get one that works better.

Location and staff were excellent. We did have some issues with the freshness of the room and the hotel itself. Upon entering to hotel and the room the stench of mildew lingered. It was definitely coming from the ac unites. They really need to maintain. See above.
They moved us to another room after we found bed bugs in the bed. They double charged my card in which I was supposed to get a night free because of the bugs.

Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and the location near DAL was good. Plenty of parking and the room and bathroom was clean. The room was clean but could use some updating. Was a little disappointed there was no fridge or microwave in the room as those are pretty standard now. We were facing the highway so it was a bit noisy.

Worst stay I have ever had. The 3 of us checked into the Crowne Plaza at Dallas Market Center location 117 119 the day after the icy weather so temps were pretty low. We walked into a very cold room and realized that the heat was not working. I go to front desk and Juan said he was sending a mechanic. Marvin arrived and apologized for the problem. After working on unit he said if it did not improve to let front desk know. Room was getting colder so I went to lobby again and spoke to another man shift change. He is unaware of the issue so I have to explain it all to him. He says hotel was booked solid and did not have another room but would send mechanic again. Marvin arrives and is very apologetic. He says he will have to leave us some space heaters in case heat does not work. it is after 1030 pm and getting ready for bed we realize there are no towels in bathroom. We call down and after finally more than 15 minutes someone answers and sends up towels. Heat never worked so we had to run electric heaters all night and this is a fire hazard. In the morning I speak to Kelly shift change who knows nothing about our problem. You would think by now all desk staff is aware there is no heat in room 403. I have to explain again. She says while we are out she is sending the head mechanic and if not fixed she will change our room. We return Thursday evening and ask Juan if our heat is working. He raises his hands up in air and said How should I know. You have to go into your room and if it is not working you have to call me. Wow thanks for your concern Juan. We walked into a warmer room and figure things are fixed. Getting ready for bed and again no towels. We call and get towels with holes. Around 1 am the room is cold again and Thank goodness heaters are still in there because not a single blanket is in room. So again we have to run heaters throughout the night. Checkout morning I speak to Kelly shift change and it is like she forgot there was a problem. We have to go through whole story about heat problem no towels no communication between staff lack of concern inconveniences and that our breakfast coupons were removed from the coffee table where we left them. Her response. Well you do not really need the coupons and sorry you did not enjoy your stay but we will be going through a billion dollar renovation and I promise your next stay will be better. REALLY. And how does that help the past two terrible nights. We were lucky the heaters did not cause a fire. The fact that we had to explain the problems repeatedly means our comfort was of no concern to anyone. At 165 per night this should have been handled differently. And taking one night off the bill does not make up for everything. We heard other people complaining about other things too and they were also not happy. The one positive thing was Marvins genuine and sincere apology and concern for our comfort. We will not stay here again.
Very friendly place and welcoming was awesome here. Need to update especially in bathrooms other than that I have enjoyed my stay.

Wow not good. Staff is friendly though. Stayed here on business travel and wow. I am glad to read this place is being renovated because it desperately needs it. Front desk staff was fabulous but I was originally sent to a room that had not been cleaned. Not their fault and they were gracious about getting me set up in another room. I had love to see this place after it is renovated because right now it is scary.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here as a family. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the pillows were puffy clouds of relaxation. Our view overlooked the downtown Dallas skyline. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful. Though the building is older the room was very clean and the temperature was perfect. The staff even helped us book an additional night when my sons flight got canceledI think in the future the carpets need to be replaced in the elevators halls and rooms. They are just old and worn. Would improve the atmosphere and make it a perfect downtown location.

We are in Dallas at a work event. My company makes me book through Priceline. I did one of those express deals for 35 stars which usually lands me in a Double Tree or a Sheraton. This time I got this place. I looked at the photos online and said ok not bad for literally 8 hours of being in a hotel. We walked in and the smell of must hits you right in the face as you walk in. The area is questionable at best it looks very rough. As we are checking in I needed to go to the ladies room so I gave the desk person my card and ID while my coworker checked in. The ladies room was disgusting. Multiple stalls had toilet paper all over the toilets and it was dirty. I find a semi decent stall and proceed to go to our room. The elevator was dirty. We get to the room and after an 11 hour drive all I want to do is shower and pass out. I take a look around the room and feel so grossed out. I start itching because of how dirty the room was. The bathtub was rusted and the rest of the bathroom was dirty there was even a dirty looking towel on the edge of the tub. It looked like there was a blood stain on the lamp shade. I found something unidentifiable on the bed. Then my coworker lays on her bed and sinks into a hole in the bed. There are stains on all the bedding. I could n’t sleep there. After 5 minutes of being in my room and calling Priceline I decided to check out and go elsewhere. This hotel is not a 35 Star hotel and it is mis rated on all the sites. It is filthy and outdated. Hopefully they approve my refund because everything is misrepresented.
My stay was good. Hotel is under construction so restaurant was in a conference room though service and food were good.

DO NOT BOOK HERE. Booking should remove this property from it ’s availability. This experience is enough for me to switch to another ap for traveling in the future. Filthy room. Water would not completely turn off in tub. Construction noise very loud. The facilities were slapped together. It looked like a shelter.

First floor was under contruction and staff was beyond rude. Was put in the wrong room type first. Was nt told about parking fee or that the tv was nt working due to satellite malfuntion. Vending machines on my floor were out of order. Decided to switch hotels and then took two hours to check out and get refund. Definitely not wasting time or money returning.

Dirty rooms and sheets. My sheets were stained and there was trash left in the room between the bed and night stands on both side. Worst of all there was a used pregnancy test in the room in the cabinet by the hair dryer. I will not visit there again. Gross.
Construction dust noise non working elevators and broken shower door made ir an awful experience. Crowne Plaza hotels used to be so nice.
The shower had a leak all night very loud. Colleague found massive hair ball in bathroom. Still under construction.

Room. My room was at the 21st flor and was in the middle of the renovtion work. I think my room was the only one available for guests at this floor all the other ones were being refurbished. Corridor ceilings opened tools and machines in the walkway noisy environment. A bottle of wine empty stayed in the corridor for 3 days next to my room. There was a coffee machine in the room but no coffee the first day to use it. The second day I had to go to the reception to get a new soap as they did not do the refill. Overall a very bad experience. I have to admit I did not go to the reception to get my room changed as I was on a business trip I did not want to pack up my stuff to change room.

Do n’t like to sleep Hot. Our room ac would n’t cool down and I had called the desk. He said he was going to send his engineer up to take a look. The guy never showed up and we had to sleep in a hot stuffy room. Also the beds are hard as a rock. My boyfriend and I both had backaches this morning. Overall nice hotel just make sure your ac works.
Sorry to say not a good experience. Very poor service in the restaurant. The TV is glitchy and small. The AC will not cool the room. Called the desk they promised to send someone. They never showed.

Average hotel but nice front desk gentleman and server. I was at the hotel for a quick overnight before an important meeting with Southwest Airlines on the morning of December 12th. Herman who checked me into my room on the afternoon of the 11th could not have been nicer. My pre assigned room was not ready at 50pm but he did find me a similar room on the same floor as a colleague that was also in town to attend the same meeting the next morning. that is outstanding service. Herman kept smiling from ear to ear the entire time he was checking me in. Nice King room. but I have to fault the limited towels in the bathroom. By the time I really checked things out after a tasty sandwich in the restaurant server Juan I believe his name was also top notch service with a smile. it was too late I thought to call down for another set of towels. do not king rooms come with two complete sets of towels to use. Then in the morning after showering the drain did not drain right. Plus the faucet in the tub kept dripping big drips of water. I hated leaving a tub fairly full of water for the housekeeper to have to deal with. I could not get the darn tub drain to stay open to drain the water out. I was running a bit late for the shuttle but did advise the front desk at check out. I had stay there again if I am in the area but I will fully check out my room and towels and tubs and drains before going to bed at 11 pm that is for sure.

Wonderful. The recent renovation is very nice. The bathroom in our room had quality lighting which I wish I had at home. The linens were fluffy and soft and an overall nice hotel. Several of our Uber drivers were unable to turn into the hotels back gates since they were closed off. Not sure if for security or if that is a permanent thing.
